text: Used to drive towards the strip to get close to a New York thin crust pizza, however, been going to Red Rock for about a year. All fresh ingredients. The owner is from Brooklyn and followed in his Father's shoes. Consistently good and priced right in a highly competitive market. We love this place.

I tried out this place when I moved in across the street. I was shocked to find such good pizza that I hadn't heard about before. Amazingly good pizza, and I hold a pretty high standard for pizza; I'd sooner not eat pizza than something mediocre. Excellent crust, great sauce and cheese, and great service. 
Since then I've ordered it as much as my diet will allow (okay, more than it would allow), it's been great every time.

Love this place! I always order delivery from them and have never been unsatisfied with the food or service. Just placed an order for a custom heart shaped pizza for valentines day and they did it with no problems! It looked fantastic and tasted even better! Great pizza. I would recommend it to anyone.
34$ for only pizza and wings. Service sucks, the food isn't good either. I rather eat chuckie cheese pizza haha.

I'd been meaning to try this place for a while and when they offered a Groupon, I couldn't resist.  I had the Lasagna pizza and it was to die for!  Meat marinara sauce, ricotta and mozzarella cheeses on a crisp, thin crust.  Yum!  The garlic knots were also heavenly and I will definitely be back for more! It's nice to eat a pizza that doesn't taste like cardboard.

It was a delicious meal! Went here after hiking to one of the many peaks of red rock. We ordered a large meat pizza for four and we took 4 1/2 slices home. Pizza was definitely worth the price! The only downside was that we had to use the restroom next door. But I think this place gets more of a delivery and or takeout kind of place :) but definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants yummy pizza!

I am a loyal customer and order pizza from these guys all the time... we love the pizza however they messed my order and their customer service handled it very poorly for that reason I will not be going back

We were looking for a new Pizza place.decided to check it out..well worth the experience. Nice relaxing atmosphere Pizza was delicious wings were outstanding.. definitely give this place a try you will be happy you did..we're coming back !
Really great quality and the people that work there are not rude like I've read in other posts

I love this place!! Everything is freshly made to order. Meatball Panini is my favorite. Today I had the Red Rock supreme pizza and it was amazing just like everything else I had there. The staff is kind and helpful. It's my go to place plus they deliver!!!!

The previous reviews of Red Rock Pizza really threw me off! I purchased a Groupon for this place and was anxious to use it!

Initially, I was a little annoyed because it was really far away from my home in the Southwest. I was impressed by the nice open kitchen--I like being able to see how they are preparing my food. We ordered a HUGE--I mean HUGE pepperoni pizza, garlic knots, salad, and bomb.com cookie. The pizza was pretty good...the crust was crispy, and it had a good amount of cheese:pepperoni ratio. The garlic knots were okay, I have had better. The salad was the most impressive part! It was HUGE for only $3.99 and the ranch was yummy. It was spicy! 

The cookie...please, try the cookies they have. I thought they were muffins when I saw them on the counter, but the nice girl who told me to try one was one smart girl! They had huge chunks of belgian chocolate and were ooey gooey perfection!

Overall, I would go back!

I ordered the delicious red rock salad, which by the way, is excellent. I took a couple of bites before leaving back to my office. As soon as I got back into my office the bag broke. I was very disappointed, the salad was delicious and very healthy and I was just about to sit down to eat it. I called the store and spoke to Paul the owner. Paul was very nice and offered to give me a new one.

I recommend this restaurant for their excellent? Service and quality of food. I will be back for more!
The pizza is one of a kind. The wings are baked and not fried. Everything here is so fresh and in about 6-8 minutes your food will be ready for you to eat.
A bit on the pricy side, but considering everything is from scratch I find myself going back again and again.

We went here for the first time and will not be back. The pizza was terrible. I will say the buffalo wings were good and the garlic knots were ok. We did not have the pasta...so maybe that's better, but as far as pizza goes, I would prefer frozen pizza over this.
Best pizza I've found in Summerlin. Lots of fresh toppings and great flavor. Not the cheapest pizza, but worth it.

It says something when a restaurant is empty on a Friday night.  It says even more when, notwithstanding, the four employees in the restaurant keep you waiting so long you end up walking out in frustration.  

I'd like to rate the food at this place, but neither I nor the dozens of people who weren't there for dinner got anything to eat there.  Service stinks at this place.

a bit of history:  i went to Italy in the summer of 2012 and got a taste of true Neapolitan pizza. since coming back from that trip, i vowed to never eat regular pizza in the US ever again.  i did try a couple restaurants in San Diego that made the Neapolitan style pizza but i have not found one that can even come close to being as awesome tasting as the pizza I ate in Italy. 

then i went to visit family in Vegas back in February...yes, 4 months ago, i know.  my in-laws had Red Rock Pizza waiting for me when i arrived.  i was hesitant to try it because it wasn't the Neapolitan style that i now love.  i took 1 bite of this pizza (veggie) and LOVED IT!!!  this is not your average pizza!  it's GOURMET.  the crust was awesome, not too thick, not doughy, not smothered in cheese that stretches out 2 feet when you take a bite, just the right amount of garlic and veggies.  i even had leftovers for breakfast the next morning.

well here we are back in Vegas and the first night we arrived we went straight to Red Rock Pizza.  this pizza does not disappoint!  the little "garlic knots" it came with are TO DIE FOR!!  this pizza is now the only "non-neoploitan" pizza i will eat in the US.

i gave this establishment 5 stars because of the flavor and freshness of the ingredients and because of the awesome crust.

Bon Appetite!

Great little joint, I think family run.  Always like to support the little guys.  Honored our expired Groupon for its value.  Clean, friendly atmosphere.  Complimentary garlic knots were delicious and had lots of garlic flavor.  Pizza was ready quick and had a nice crisp crust. My daughter devoured her chicken wings and said they were very tasty.  The only thing this place needs is a restroom.  There may have been one in the outdoor mall area, we didn't ask.  All in all, a solid place and would definitely go back when we are on that side of town.

Amazing pizza!  Plain and simple!
Their pizza didn't make me feel like crap after I ate it. That's a big thumbs up!
Great Pizza ! A little on the expensive side but very Good. We will continue to trade with this company.

We stopped in and endured a 40+ minute  wait time that was not worth it. As those after us were given their orders I assumed they forgot us despite us sitting in the small dining area. We asked about our order so we could cancel and during that longer than needed conversation, the food came up. The garlic knots were dry and the pizza eh. Pretty disappointing :-(

Ordered a ham & pineapple pizza for delivery after hearing good things but was sadly disappointed. The crust was more like cardboard & overall the pie basically tasteless. Hope this was an anomaly but probably won't try again. My guests concurred...

The widow maker pizza is scrumptious!!!!!  They also make the best canolis, hands down, no question simply the best canolis you can find anywhere!!!!  And they deliver, always prompt, always nice and friendly and the food is excellent.  Nice thin crust pizza, cooked to perfection, high quality food and nice friendly staff!!!!

Just had a salad and pizza (veggie wedgie) and will go back again and again.  The food is too good to not go back.  The service is excellent, and the time we spend there is well worth the price.      We love this place.

I'm from Chicago. So I do know a couple of thing's about pizza & lil' bit about food. 30yrs. will do that! 

Anyhow, Red Rock Pizza is very good. It has that "fresh taste" to it which can only be accomplished with you guessed it, fresh ingredients! 

As far as price, ll'I on the high side. 

But goes w/ the saying, you get what you pay for, you pay for what you get. 

Only have had delivery service. Never have had any problems. Food always on time & very hot.  

If your seeking quality, then this is the place.

Loses one star for the price. After all, we do live in a desert.

I drive miles out of my way to get pizza here. The pizza is beyond freakin awesome! I have order specialty, 1 and 2 item pie and it has been great every time.  The staff is friendly and the owner is very cool. I recommend it to everyone who will listen and i recommend it to you as well.

After I wrote the review, the owner contacted me to apologize, and refund my money.  I always liked this pizza.  However, customer service is just as important to me as the food served.  My star review averages subpar customer service with the good quality of pizza.
Terrible experience!!!
I use to love this place.  Actually it was the only pizza place I ate at, however after what I experienced today I will never go back.  I got pizza, and a salad delivered.  The salad was wilted, and brown rotten.  When I called to notify them, a girl on the phone (who later claimed to be the owner) tried to refuse that the brown salad was rotten, and stated it was just a little oxidized.  I wish I had time to take a picture of the brown, soggy lettuce, however I was too busy chancing down the delivery man so that he may exchange it.  30 min later he came back with a new salad drenched in dressing (my order stated dressing on the side). When I called back the same girl gave me a fake apology, and hung up on me.  I also want to say I am pregnant ( which I told her), and eating any kind of rotten food can be harmful to my baby. I drove to the place asking for my money back, and again the girl gave me attitude. First she said there was no manager, but then she told me she was the owner.  At that point I lost all trust, and didn't want to eat the salad she probably spit in.  She had absolutely no customer service skills.  On the other hand, the gentleman that refunded me for the salad was extremely gracious.  Now, about the pizza.  The pizza was ok but more greasy than usual, which I didn't like.  Also it always takes this place an hour to deliver to my house, even though I live 5 minutes from their location.  I never cared about the wait before, but the food just isn't the same anymore. Now I have to find a new pizza place, it's a shame. :(

I just had an awful experience. 
So, we just moved into the neighborhood Red Rock Pizza is located, from The Vistas. Like today, still have movers moving things, been schlepping boxes all day, today. It was 7 pm, and I needed to feed my 6 year old. We are vegans, and usually we can have a veggie calzone without cheese no problem. But still I asked "do you cook your marinara with chicken stock?" "No, no animal products in the marinara whatsoever." 
So long story short, the $26 veggie calzone arrived, and since I don't have utensils, I ripped it in half, poured the sauce into both halves, then set them aside to let them cool. 
I then served my daughter a piece, and she started eating. I finished what I was doing then sat down to eat with her. The little bits I thought were garlic in the sauce were actually Parmesan. Crap. 
So I called Red Rock Pizza and they were immediately defensive. I just wanted my money back. I couldn't wait another 45 minutes for them to make another and send it to my house! They treated me like I was lying about putting the sauce on both halves. They told me they didn't tell me to put the sauce on it (even though I asked and was told of course they don't use animal products.) my husband called them and was told a new one would be made and sent. They sent a half-sized calzone to replace the large I ordered and paid for. 
So, the mistake with the cheese would have earned them 4 stars if they rectified the situation. They handled it so poorly that I'd give them a 2, but since they then sent a half sized calzone instead of trying to make it right as they argued they wanted to, they get a 1. They would get a zero if I could. 
Very disappointed and I would not recommend eating there unless you are willing to shut up and eat what they tell you to eat. I certainly wouldn't have ordered from them if they were honest in the first place. Sad, but I've never experienced customer service quite like it. I hope Paul is the owner and not just a manager. Talk about running a business into the ground.

Just received a delivery from Red Rock Pizza on Lake Mead/Rampart of a pepperoni pizza that tasted like a cold cardboard frozen piece of crap. It was cold, flat, tasteless and tasted worse than a frozen dollar store pizza. So after waiting over forty five minutes for it I'm more than dissapointed.  Will never shop here again and neither should anyone else... 

When I talked to the Manager about it he was very defensive and stated he had been there eight years, not sure what that has to do with tasteless pizza except that maybe he's telling me its been that horrible for eight years and I should just go to a chain if that how I feel.... WTH?

The pizza is great but customer service is awful. I've ordered pizza from here many many many times over the years and occasionally use a coupon or special offer as they are pricey. Today the "acting manager" told me they can not use my coupon for delivery regardless of fact that there are no limitations on the actual coupon. They just have an internal problem with their employees not collecting the coupons when they deliver. Why should I (long time customer) be punished for the incompetent behavior of the employees they choose to hire. If they put a coupon out, they should write dine in or pick up only on it, if they want to enforce this. I feel that customer service is so important, if you want repeat business and referrals... And in this case they obviously don't care about pleasing a hungry and longtime loyal customer.  I vowed to Jonathan (acting manager this evening) to tell others what horrible customer service I experienced.

My wife, youngest son and I hit this place up while recently in area from out of state. Second time for me and the boy, first for my wife. We absolutely LOVE this pizza! My son had a pepperoni pizza and my wife and I shared one of the house combos. I wish I could remember the name but it had several meats and no veggies on it. They were both absolutely wonderful! Toppings were delicious and we love their pizza crust!

While waiting, an employee brought us a sample of their garlic knots...mmmm...

We highly recommend this place and will definitely go back next time we're in the Las Vegas area!
I love this place! Everything I've eaten from there has been delicious & the staff is always so nice. I love that it's a family business too. The Buffalo Chicken Pizza is soooo good!

Wow! Great sauce! Great crust, the pizza was delicious!  We let them know it was our first visit so they would be patient while we looked at the menu, not only did they make suggestions, but gave us free garlic knots while we waited for pizza!  We loved this place and will return when we are in town.

I have been called a pizza lover and a pizza slayer. I do love my pizza. So you can imagine how sad I have been on my search for great pizza around here. All the places we have tried that people rave about have been mediocre. Until we tried Red Rock Pizza. Delivery or Pick up this is the place to get your pie from. Our go to is just a pepperoni with extra cheese, but we have tried a few of the other specialties and haven't had a complaint. We also recently fell in love with their Stromboli! So mouth watering good.  They are always fast and the staff is friendly. So I guess what I am trying to say is, if you are looking for amazing pizza, look no further. Edited this to take off a star because the past few times we have been there the pizza has been super soggy from grease and just not the best. Will maybe try again in the future because their Stromboli was the best around, but we will be taking a break from ordering here for awhile.

Food: Quality of the food  is pretty good they have surprising combinations of suggested pizza toppings that you would think would not work taste wise. But the flavors works very well. The Garlic knots were good, the kind of pizza that is definitely better than the pizza chain versions.

Ambiance: Typical Pizza Joint better for take out than dine In.

Overall: If your looking for a good pizza for takeout that is not pizza chain then this is a good place to find a great tasting take out Pizza. 

I would definitely try their other pizza combinations.

Delicious!  We got the Bianco pizza with ricotta, mozzarella and added mushrooms.  The crust was thin yet full of flavor and had a great texture.  The ricotta was amazing. We got it delivered and it arrived within 30 minutes.  A bit pricey but definitely worth every penny.

My usual place was closed so I had remembered this place, went here one other time and it was just ok only to return again to have an even worse experience. I ordered 2 cheese slices well done, crispy to go. I had a seat, received a phone call and waited over 10 minutes to be handed a box where I was sitting, I decided to open it and start eating, I was starving. I never in my life ate pizza where no oil ever dripped out the back when lifting it to my mouth or cheese stretching when taking a bite, the pizza was cold, dry, hard, not crispy but stale, stiff and thinner than the box it came in, I was shocked being I waited over 10 minutes for this order, it was obviously old and sitting there a while. Had I not been busy on the phone and starving I would have thrown it right back at them and walked out, are you kidding me? This is a good way to go out of business if thats what you are after. There were more than enough people working behind the counter, it was like a party back there, the date was 7/10/2017 at 4:45/5 pm if this helps the owner.

I ordered a fairly large "catering" order yesterday, and was very pleased with the service I received. The Margherita pizza and homemade salad dressings went over very well. My order was also delivered on time, and with no mistakes! If I had any reason not to give a full 5 stars, it would be because our 2 Party-sized salads were full of brown and rind lettuce. Other than that, it was great!!

Wow one of the best real
Family Italian food you can eat they are so friendly and the food even in those expansive Italian restaurants you can't fast food like that really I swear the best experience you can have

Maybe it's my aspirational New Years resolutions, maybe it's my general lack of self control around carbs, but I love any pizzeria that offers a by-the-slice lunch option: the version here comes with two slices and a drink (bottled, not canned) for $6, with the option to add on toppings at fifty-cents apiece.

Found the crust to seem oddly premade given the uniformity of the thickness and turned-over crust. Did not have bad taste though. Cheese was quality, and I appreciated that the pizza here was not as greasy as most other by-the-slice places in town. Full-pie menu offers vegetarian specialty and carnivorous specialty topping versions, menu also has pasta dishes, sandwiches, and dessert.

Location has an open kitchen that is kept clean, polite service, and some minimal Italian theme d√©cor. I particularly like the grape lights lining the windows. Casual atmosphere or grab-and-go sort of place, also offers delivery.
We ordered the New York pizza and it was dabomb...one of the best pizza places in town

If they had 3.5 stars I would have given it that. 

I had started working in the area not too long ago and I am always looking for a good place to eat. I asked around if any of my coworkers had eaten at this place and none had tried it. It wasn't until one of the customers that came in said it was good. So then my boss and I decided to go for lunch and be the guinea pigs of the group. 

First impression of the place; it looks like a mom and pop shop with the way the kitchen is set up. The making of the pizza is kind of secluded so it was a little different in that sense. Other than that it was a nice atmosphere. 

We then saw the special, which by any standard is pretty good. 2 slices with a topping and a 20oz. soda for $6.95. We were excited that it was very affordable. 

Customer service was below par by our standards so we weren't impressed with that. The wait was not long before we got our pizza and soda. When we got back to work to eat it we found that it wasn't the most amazing pizza ever but it is decent. 

This place will be on the list for whenever we are craving something quick, affordable, and have a craving for some pizza.

Ordered again last week. Everything still the same... PERFECT. I've seen some reviews talking about the price and wait time for delivery. It is a bit pricy and it takes about an hour to get a pie but well worth both. Still my go to.
Love this place! Consistency is everything and every time we grab food from here it's just as good as the last time.

Cliffs Notes: 
I live in Summerlin, and this is by far the best pizza delivery option. My go to favorites are the Widowmaker and the BBQ chicken but I often split a onion/garlic/sausage/pepperoni with a friend at work for lunch. 

Full Review

So this place is obviously not Pizza Rock quality, but I don't think anyone could expect that from a residential delivery place. If you are a pizza snob this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a step up over Pizahut/Dominos kind of place than this is great. 

Some notes on the Pizza
Price wise this place is about 75-100% more expensive than your average delivery chain for just about everything- pizza, drinks, wings etc. 

A few reviews have raved about the "fresh ingrediants"- this is not exactly true. Their sauce comes out of a jar, I have never seen anyone slicing vegetables etc- they seem to use your run of the mill restaurant supply ingrediants. I wouldn't really expect anything different for the price but if you are a fresh food fenatic you may be dissapointed.


Delivery times- I live 2 miles from the place, I work about 500 feet from it. Delivery takes about 45 minutes to an hour whereas pickup takes 20 minutes so I would highly suggest picking it up to avoid getting the pizza past its prime. 

Wings- I love chicken wings and these are perfectly passable delivery wings given that we have no dedicated wing joint in summerlin. They are baked not fried which does negate the crispness a little but not too much.

Garlic knots- yes these are pretty good. You get 1-2 with your pizza depending on the size, would recommend getting a side order to avoid fights to the death in a situation of GK scarcity.
Always top notch service and great pIzza.  Sure more expensive than some place, but quality will usually cost more.

Stopped in for a few slices after not dining here for several months because the pizza was so bad, and now I remember why I stopped eating here !! The pizza was soggy soaked in grease and just not good. The Pizza is just plain bad here, and even though this place is less then a minute from my house I will not be dining here anymore ...
The pizza and cheesecake were delicious, but the Canoli I had tasted like it was filled with plaster. I tried to call to give a comment but no one answered the phone.

Ordered for delivery with my vegan demands and toddler's preferences. Both of us loved the pizza... we ordered a large with no cheese and black olives and mushrooms. Nice thin crust that tastes clean, simple and delicious. Yay.

No way. People putting 4 stars or better. I plain think they are crazy or don't know what good pizza is. FAR too expensive for what you get. Very sparce on the ingriedient side. I just felt ripped. And nothing special on the taste either. I mean, it was ok, but that's it.

Although I have only been here once while traveling the Vegas area, their price, convenience, and overall good quality food stood out to me.  While shopping for dog food next door, I needed something for myself and noticed this little pizza shop right next door.  I received two hurkin' pieces of pizza with a drink all for a reasonable price.  It was finger-lickin good!!!

It's a shame my review get deleted after I rated it bad. I'm not sure who deleted it, but I was sick for a whole week from eating from a pizza shop. So I contacted Environmental Health. Well I did get a follow-up report from them and the restaurant received a "C". I'm sure it would have gotten something lower if the worker didn't put on a show that day. What wrong is I was stating the truth and sharing my experience. I also have proof from DEH. You would think others would like to know the good, and the bad. But I guess not on yelp. Anyway I guess I wont be writing anymore reviews for restaurants, since i'm scared of going out to eat again due to getting sick.  

I'm sure this will get deleted as well.

Looked up pizza places near where i was & came across this place. At first i was a little skeptical because im picky with my pizza but man let me tell you their pizza was delicious. I had just a regular pepperoni but it was delicious. I also tried the garlic knots & they we're just the right amount of crispy on the outside & soft on the inside. My girlfriend had the Italian sausage & she also enjoyed her pizza. Highly recommend!

Great food! Their pizza is always fresh. Awesome garlic knots. Try the Taco Nacho pizza or the Eggplant Rolatini pizza- you won't regret it! They also make all of their dressing from scratch. It's amazing. Minus one star for the lack of comprehension by the employees when ordering over the phone.

Best NY style pizza in town! Very family and perfecture oriented. Wings are amazing; being baked too! Red Rock Salad, mostly organic spring greens topped with fresh cut Mozz, roasted red peppers and red onion.  The house made Greek vinaigrette throws an amazing bang. Stuffed shells and other pasta dishes and desserts, such as Canollies made fresh every day etc. Every dessert, pasta, pizza and apps and fresh herbs made from scratch daily make this family that seems fueled by old NY pizza culture

Best pizza in town!!! Love it!!
I like everything on the menu! Everything super fresh and they have excellent costumer service!

I ordered this for the office, and asked for a specific delivery time, which they met. But they only get 3 stars because I had asked for mushrooms on only half of the Chicken Alfredo pizza, and it was covered with them. And out of all the toppings to pick off, mushrooms are the hardest.

We also got the Veggie Wedgie which was a hit. And a garden salad which was great, very fresh, the dressing were all really good. We had the ranch and balsamic, they tasted made in house.

It is a pricier pizza place but all the ingredients were fresh and worth it.

I had the Margherita pizza. I'm usually a huge fan of Margherita no matter where I order it from. This one left a lot to be desired. It was decent. Not outstanding by any means. I won't order it again.
Garlic knots were good though.
Great selection of specialty and unique pizzas. Very fresh ingredients and good crispy crust. Definitely a regular and top choice for the Las Vegas market.

I searched pizza delivery in my neighborhood & one of the options was Red Rock Pizza. In a listing of 1 & 2 stars, RRP stood out with 4. The menu looked different so I went for it.  Ordered (for delivery) mild chicken fingers & a half BBQ chicken/half Maui (add red onion) pizza. It arrived to my house in the time frame I was given & the delivery person was very pleasant (as was the guy who took my order). The ranch dressing was not my favorite- too running, not much flavor. But the chicken fingers had great flavor & texture & both pizza types were flavorful & yummy. I also liked that it wasn't greasy. In the pizza box, you get a garlic knot. Again, good texture & I liked that the garlic wasn't overpowering. Definitely worth a try & I will not hesitate ordering from Red Rock Pizza again. Oh! & it's worth noting: Their chicken fingers are baked. So when you have leftovers, they are still delicious the next day, unlike when they're fried. 350* for 15min & voila!, the breading & chicken have maintained their integrity!

Red rock pizza is so delish. The ingredients are as fresh as it comes. Customer service is fab!! After eating their pizza its hard to even think of papa johns, pizza hut and these other chain pizza joints. Thank you Red Rock for your fabulous food and service.

I was looking forward to having a slice at Pizza Rock.  I read good reviews.  When I got my slice I was surprised that the pepperoni's were very low quality (the ones that turn to grease).  They were the little dime sized pepperoni's.   I'm a local so I can go to many of the other great pizza places here and I will.

Roxanne
Best pizza I've had in Vegas. I grew up in Manhattan and this place is very similar to standard great NY pizza. The gourmet pizzas are very good and fun.

Awesome pizza! So fresh and so darn good. The spinach pesto mushroom feta sausage pine nut pie is ridiculous.  
I got wings too. I love being fat. They were some of the best i ever had. Anywhere.  
Service was prompt and super friendly.
Price is right too. 
Go here now

I just can't say enough about very quality and good pizza.  Red Robin does it all.  My sister ordered the Mediterranean and the Five Cheese, which includes Swiss, very delicious.  The Mediterranean very nice with both mozzarella and feta, sauteed (believe me--that makes a difference) mushrooms, zucchini, sweet roasted garlic (very awesome) and Greek olives.  The thin crust with toppings to the edge where you don't even have to ask for extra cheese.  Pay for the quality - it's worth it!
Red Rock pizza is our favorite pizza place! You get a $5 off coupon on top of every pizza box, which is nice. We always get the Bianco with meatballs, delicious!!
Some of the best pizza I've ever had! The staff was super friendly and had great recommendations. The Pueblo pizza was delicious!

We've been ordering pizza from Red Rock for 10 years.  What else do you need to know?  Except that we only only their vegetarian pizzas.  They're great, and you won't miss the greasy meat.  Try it, and you won't go back,

This is the best quality and tasting pizza in town. My favorites are the tesero, eggplant rolatini, Pueblo , and taco nacho. Try other things on menu too! There salads , paninis, and chicken fingers are awesome with to die for homemade dressings. The staff is friendly and makes you feel like family. Apparently the secret is out you may have to wait on Friday or Saturday cause they get so busy, but it is always worth it. Bit pricey but you get what you pay for you want quality healthy to and to mind blow your taste buds this is your spot.

The prices are out of control. On one late evening i order a medium supreme pizza. I placed my order over the phone with a guy who seemed super rushed. By the end of the order i wanted to ask for the total bill of my medium pizza, however the guy hung up. Instead of me calling back i assume ok the pizza shouldnt be no more than 15 dollars its only a medium supreme. 40 mins later the delivery guy shows up, my husband met him outside to pay for the pizza. To my surprise this medium supreme pizza ended up being 30$, just for one damn pizza, with no drinks or added toppings. I will never order again from here, even if the pizza is good because its way to expensive and i believe that this resturant is getting over on people with these outrages prices that dont even reflect their menu.

I've been here a couple of times, and have enjoyed each of the pizzas I've gotten. I will say that I prefer very basic pizzas from Red Rock the most. Basic cheese pizza or pepperoni pizza. Any more toppings than that and the crust seems to get a little too soggy for my taste. My assumption would be that other toppings add to the moisture, but that typically happens with 3 or more toppings. Here it happened with just two toppings. Mine could have also been a fluke. Anyway, I do still enjoy their pizza and the staff has always been very nice. The prices are also good, especially since you always get a coupon for your next order. I'm sure I'll be back.

Not bad, I didn't like their crust, it was too thin- like a cracker. The toppings were fresh- and you could tell they use good ingredients. I didn't like that they don't use a fryer for their wings and fingers- everything is baked. Yea- I know it's healthier but if I want baked chicken tenders I can make that in my own oven.
Villa Pizza is still #1 in my book.

I ordered a medium pepperoni (like $15) which is one step up from a personal pizza.  Ok, not cheap but ok.  It was super hot - great - but when I got home and looked at the pizza it TRULY could have been a FROZEN pizza.  You know how the crust on frozen is flat and kind of tastes like cardboard?  That described the crust.  The other disappointing thing was there was NO pizza "bone" on the crust.  The doughy end part.  It was flat all the way to the ends but not a traditional thin crust pizza. If you look closely at their photo you can kind of tell this but I did not look super closely as I never dreamed I would receive a pizza like this for this price.  When I placed the order I asked if it was a typical round pizza and was told it was a traditional New York Style pizza - more like a traditional frozen pizza. Red Rock was also empty of any customers. Next time I will do even MORE homework until I find that perfect pizza! Too bad, I could have had frozen for cheaper and same or better pizza. Bummer!
Horrible pizza! I was so disappointed with it. Even Dominos has better pizza than this crap. The 5 star Yelpers for this place must be related to the owner.

I went to Red Rock Pizza based on the reviews I saw on yelp. My experience wasn't as good as fellow yelpers. The customer service was okay, the kid working behind the register was assisting another worker with the register and took the time to explain which items were popular with customers. After that we order our food. We ordered the medium cheesesteak pizza and the stuffed shells and a side of meatballs also a cheesecake to go. Well to start, the pizza dough was tough and cheesesteak was burnt on various areas of the pizza. The pasta shells for the stuffed shells and the meatballs were dry and the cheesecake had the consistency of a nice dense cheesecake however it had no flavor. This is probably one of the biggest disappointments I've had an an eatery. Not one of our items that we ordered were up to standard. It was the first time and probably be the last time we visit this restaurant. Btw, it cost me $42 for this experience. I should've went to McDonald's for a McRib

I ordered delivery solely based on the customer reviews and so when we got our order, an hour later (garlic knots, pizza and a small salad), I was pretty hungry and absolutely ready to dig in only to be disappointed in the crust, flavor and overall anticipation.  I'd pick Dominoes over this, and I'm a pizza snob.  I'll stick with DeMarco's, Grimaldi's, Pizza Rock, anything else next time.

Wow!  Red Rock Pizza is amazing. I wouldn't think I ordering from anywhere else. I am originally from the Chicago area, and I know a good pizza.  My favorite items on their menu are the garlic knots, cheesy onion rolls, baked crispy honey BBQ wings,  the Greek salad, my cheese and sausage pizza, and last, but not least, a cannoli for dessert!

Not pleased with this place at all.  Upon arriving the place was empty.  We walked to the counter where we were greated by a lady who you could tell did not want to be there.  She asked us what we wanted and then told us to take a seat.  We ordered two lunch specials (2 slices and a soda) for $13 which I assumed would be quick.  We waited over 20 min while the employees in there booty shorts played on the phone and chatted.  A young man finally brings us our pizza with no words,  just hands it to us and walks away. No thank you, sorry about the wait or come again. 
     The pizza was Luke warm,  soggy and the pepperoni was still uncooked.  There are too many other pizza places in this city to eat here again!

Did not have a very good experience here tonight. First of all it was very warm in there which made everything else even more uncomfortable. They were out of pepperoni. What pizza place is out of pepperoni?! The girl working told us they couldn't find it. The owner's daughter rushed in to the store. I told my husband to get up and ask if they had found the pepperoni because that's the topping he likes, and they had. But no one told us, we had to ask. We waited 45 minutes for our food. When my calzone was delivered I cut it in half and the cheese inside was not even melted. I put my fork in it to taste it and it was really cold. Once they finally cooked that all of the way, it was actually very very good. 
This place usually has outstanding service. They seemed very flustered tonight and therefore the service lacked. And something must be wrong with the air conditioning. Bummed.
Chicken Marcella is the bomb....Super fast delivery...When you want a night off from cooking this place is a can't miss...

This pizza is by far the best pizza that I've tasted. It's prepared with a really fresh ingredients and it is a little pricey but you're paying for the quality. I recommend this to everyone! If you have not ate here before you are missing out. The best part about it is that they deliver.

The food was ok but the service was awful might be great for take out but eating in is  not the best option. Food came out in stages and some of it was cold. No bathroom for customers. Had to go next door to the dog food place to wash my hands. Get it to go but don't eat in.

I just wanted to write this review just to say thank you!  During Valentine's Day, I wanted to do something nice for my husband and didn't really know what to do until I thought about sending my husband a heart shaped pizza while I was at work. I called red rock pizza since it was down the street from where I lived and simply asked them if they would make a pizza shaped in a heart and deliver it to my husband. They said yes and they totally delivered. 

I asked for a medium pizza with pepperoni with banana peppers. And all I can say was I was very impressed that they even took the time to cut the pepperonis into hearts. That was totally unexpected. It was a success and my husband was very happy. 

This isn't the only time I have tried red rock. Their vegetarian pizza called the Pueblo is so delicious too! But I will definitely be ordering more often from red rock! Thank you so much for the effort and little details that made my day.

Red Rock Pizza you were a one night stand. BOOM. The pie was delicious. Clarification- The half of the pizza you got right. Thanks to previous Yelpers reviews we purposely ordered in person to make certain the order was not screwed up. He repeated our order when we ordered it. He then yelled out a second time while he was making it just to make sure and it was still wrong! Are you for real? I didn't mean to kill the rabbit George......Sorry, had to go there. 

The half of the pizza that was outstanding and worth many more dates was the Pineapple, Jalapeno and Mushroom side. On point Red Rock. Then I dipped it in their insanely divine homemade garlic ranch dressing. Pizza party!!!! I also enjoyed the crispiness of the chicken wings and the dressing on the Caesar Salad, too. Good times. The other half of my pie was a fail with zero sauce and zero flavor. Come on.

Although they threw in a couple of garlic knots to the mix I still don't think they earn the other two stars. The food is above decent, but the price and service leaves alot to be desired. Thanks for a good time Red Rock Pizza, but I don't think you are my type. It's not me, it's you....

We eat at Red Rock Pizza about once a week.   Why? Because they have the best Pizza, the best salads, the best sandwiches, the best of everything we have ever tasted.   Heck, Nicholas Cage eats here all the time and he can eat anywhere he wants.   You cannot go wrong eating at Red Rock Pizza!
Pizza was decent, but what I didn't like was the dirty finger nails of the cashier it did gross me out , it's definitely not the same since the new owner took over

Review is for delivery only. 
Called my order in, and the girl who took my order (pepperoni and mushroom pizza) was very polite. Delivery arrived within half an hour, and the delivery kid was sweet too. The pizza was completely loaded with pepperoni and mushrooms, the crust was a little thicker than I was expecting, but nice and crispy. I'll definitely have to hit up the restauran, and will update.

I lived in Summerlin for about a year and a half and this was my go-to pizza place. A little pricier than the chains but it more than makes up for it by being the absolute best quality pizza in town. You can tell that the ingredients are very fresh and the dough is excellent as well. The Mediterranean is my favorite on the menu.
Deeeellllliiiiicccccoooooouuuuuussssss!!!!!!!!!!!! Some of the best pizza I've had in the Summerlin area!!! Dank wings as well
Amazing pizza, my husbands from New York and is particular.. if he approves I know it's good .

I am what most people would call a pizza lover. I would eat it everyday if I could. I never knew this place existed until I walked in one day. I was leisurely walking by when the intoxicating smells lured me in to try a slice. One bite of the NY stlye, thin crust pizza, and I was in love. The cheese was melted to perfection and the crust had the perfect amount of crunch. I asked the man who owns the shop his secret and he simply replied, "fresh and homemade ingrediates." To this day, I refuse to eat pizza from anywhere else. They recently added pasta and paninis which are equally delectable. This is a must try place. But I warn you, one bite and you'll be hooked. You'll never go back to processed Dominos or Pizza Hut again. That's a guarantee!!!!!

I stopped by here for lunch and tried out their lunch special, 2 slices of cheese and a 20 ounce bottled soda for $5.95 including tax. There were 3 employees inside when I walked in who all greeted me and were very nice. They have tables inside and a TV. I sat at a table while my food was being prepared and it wasn't long before it was ready. I also asked for a "Cannoli" priced at $3.25 to be packed to-go and it was made fresh to order. The pizza was just so-so to me. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't great. The price was certainly right! The Cannoli was actually very good and one of the best I have had. Those alone are worth stopping by for.

They offer delivery to a wide range of the valley.
Great pizza and great service. Pizza was on time and quite good. Solid crust and quality toppings. I didn't feel like I was eating plastic cheese.

Small place, but good pizza.  The only negative is that the crust is fairly thin, but that's just a preference thing.  Even their plain cheese pizza was good.  Have only been there a couple times but they have some interesting sounding topping combinations that I want to try.  Food has always been piping hot.  More expensive than the large chain places, but tastes better.

Can you say yummy? Yes you can. Great pizza. Fast service. Huge servings. Ordered a medium and was very surprised. Great service. How many pizza guys ask you if they can help you to your car these days? Red rock pizza does. Visiting family. This was a great find. Thanks RRP!
This is the best pizza in town.  Cannoli is the best I ever had.  Paulo is an awesome guy. Treats you like family. Don't miss out on this place.

I've passed this place at least 100x and have never stopped to check it out.  Today I stopped for some lunch.  As I pulled up to the restaurant, I noticed the sign in front of the joint that said "2 Slices & Soda $5.95".....perfect!

I asked the guy at the counter if the 2 Slice Special is more or less Pizza than a Personal 10" Pizza....he said the 2 Slice Special has more Pizza, so I went with it.  The special price is for Cheese only, to add more toppings it's $.50 ea, so I decided to add Pepperoni & Sausage to both slices.....total damage $6.95.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SQ8Tkavc4TJj-2kanEDzLg?select=Z2zzt8zXaQBX8doxb9-58g

I then grabbed a Soda out of the beverage cooler, they have Coke Zero, score!  I'm not much of a Soda drinker, but there are 4 Sodas I have a tough time saying no to.....Mexican Coke or Pepsi, Pepsi Max, and Coke Zero.  I swear they put liquid Crack in Coke Zero!

After a short wait, my Pizza was ready.  The Crust is slightly thicker than a NY Style Pizza and you must fold the Pizza if you want to eat it properly, otherwise you'll have to use a knife and a fork....which is a Sin!  I took one bite and thought the Pizza was really good.  The Pepperoni was great, quality stuff.  The Sausage was pretty good, but not great......was missing "something".  The Pizza had the perfect proportion of ingredients.....the Cheese or Sauce didn't overwhelm the Pizza.....which is a common mistake at some Pizza joints.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SQ8Tkavc4TJj-2kanEDzLg?select=wjkjIIETK87tO8549L0MaQ

Overall, I thought it was really good Pizza.  I was left wanting more.....I could have easily eaten another 2 Slices......next time I'm ordering a Medium for myself...ha!

I noticed their sign that said their Wings were Baked, not Fried.....heard from Matt S that it's some of the best Wings in town.....have to try that next time!

Return Factor - 90%

It's been a while since I've been in the area, but since I was, I decided to stop for some pizza. Good idea. As I thought. It's so hard to find good pizza in LV, and this is the best. Definitely did not disappoint. Just got a plain cheese. Good amount of cheese and sauce, which is very tasty and not bland like most places. The crust isn't rubbery like some places, and the oven cooks to perfection. They have a conveyor oven, which some people think is bad, but trust me, they are way better than the traditional deck ovens that cook unevenly and drop temperature every time you open the oven door. It makes for a perfect pizza. I've eaten everything basically here in the past and they have some of the best ingredients anywhere. They have a lot of good specialty/gourmet pizzas, and wings that are oven baked, not fried. If you are in the area, or not, and are looking for good pizza, this is the place to go.

Pizza was decent, not amazing, what was a real turn off is that no one was in the establishment, it was pizza day at my daughters school, I told them my order and advised them I was in a bit of a rush because my daughters lunch was in 40 minutes. They took their slow time to make the pizza and I was 10 minutes late for her lunch, when I got there she was in tears thinking I was never coming, I was the only customer in there so I'm not for sure why it took so long to make a personal size pizza. They could tell I was bothered and when I asked about my order they had no clue how long, keep saying it's coming it's coming. I will not be returning, unfortunately the professionalism left a bad taste in my mouth
Outstanding thin crust margherita. We used to go to Sabatino's on Cheyenne, but quality has declined recently. This is our new go-to.

So if you want huge great pizza for a great price this is the place! Pizza isn't sitting in a heater over for you to order, it's made fresh. They have the best garlic knots ever and the overall experience is just so nice. Everyone's so helpful and polite, the location is perfect as well.
Great pizza, but mannnn! These people are not friendly. Overpriced pizza should have great customer service...does not.

Just came here after work for a quick slice. DAMN impressed! It's just as good as Grimaldis if not better. 2 big  pepperoni slices and a 20 oz soda for 7.95. VERY NICE STAFF and super clean. Menu prices are very reasonable! Can't wait to come back and try a panini or specialty pizza :D
I love this. Great pie.  Best I've had in vegas for sure. Fresh tasty ingredients.   Wonderful

If there communication skills and customer service matched their foods, this place would be much better. Last two times I've ordered and showed up at the ready time there is no pizza.  "They didn't but the order in" is what they tell me. They must make you a pizza while you wait an additional 30 minutes. They are also great about forgetting your add on's. I told them it was the second time in a row they did this and they did not even offer to make it right

We were walk ins a couple of nights ago.  We ordered our pizzas and salad to go.  Then we sat there for 40 minutes.  No one checked in on us either.  We saw the delivery driver come back and look shocked to see us still sitting there.  My husband got up to ask about our order just as they were bringing it out, the woman behind the counter comes out and says.  "just for future orders know that our pizzas take about 20 minutes to make", we looked at her and said, "but ours took 40 minutes", she says, "well we are busy tonight"... No, I'm sorry, no I didn't realize. nada

We took our pizzas home and were sad about the lack of flavors.  We ordered the cheesesteak pizza (no steak just ground beef with NO seasoning) and the cajun queen... again, not cajun level of spice.

The crust on the pizzas was thin and crunchy, great crust, just not a good all around pizza.
Great pizza and staff.  Have done takeout about 20 times and the employees are always friendly and helpful.  Pizza is always consistently good.

My favorite pizza place in Vegas. Great delivery times and never late. I have tried over half the menu and haven't got anything I didn't like so far. 5 stars for great customer service and amazing food.

The server/cashier was pleasant but had dirt under his nails.  Was very turned off when he handed me the food.  They keep slices in the back so you cant see them which with slices I like to see to know how fresh they are. The slices weren't great either.

Oh my god the Chicken Marsala pizza with green olives is the best ever!!! Wow looks like everything made from scratch , my new favorite for gourmet pizza's in Las Vegas. My family is all in love with this place

I just moved here 1 month ago. I wanted to try something local instead of your normal chain pizza place. I found this on Google. This place states over and over that they use fresh never frozen products. That is definitely a lie. I ordered a pizza, cheese bread, and chicken wings. I was told to pick it up in 25min. I was there in 20min and it was already done. I live 3 miles away. By the time I made it home it was all cold. There is no way it was made when I order it. The chicken was absolutely terrible. It was definitely microwaved. It was so hard and like eating shards of glass. My wife and kids would not eat any of it. I spent 40 dollars and through it all away. Please do not waste your time. If I could save 1 person from eating at this disgusting place then this review would be worth it.

I love the freshness and quality ingredients at Red Rock Pizza. This is the reason we come. Take out is our game. As well as the pizza by the slice lunch option: this is necessary for me if you want me to take you seriously as a proper pizzeria. You can really taste the fresh ingredients in that sauce, you won't even have to try. The pies are simple and not sitting on grease. From the dough to the sauce and the toppings, you can taste everything in it. That's awesome. They have jalape√±os :) plus other fun topping options and combos.

Excellent food. The pizza is full of vegetables and the baked ziti is the best I've had! The prices may seem higher than other pizza places, but the pizza is much better than any other pizza place in town, so it's more than worth it!!
Please open your eyes to you recent reviews. Your food use to be good. Now it's not that great. What happened???  Come on guys get your S@:;T together.

I would have rated this 5 stars if it wasn't my first time here. The Widowmaker I ordered plus Greek spinach and artichoke hearts was excellent and their sausage is the best. Overall, one of the best pizzas I ever had. A big plus is that they give you fresh Parmesan and red peppers, not the little paper pouches that most places give you for takeout. I'll be back!

YUMMY PIZZA, very tasty garlic knots! The sauce served with the knots was very well seasoned and unexpected. My mouth is watering just writing this review. DANGIT! Can't believe I forgot the leftovers at home. 
Wish this place was bigger so more folks could hang out and enjoy. We were going to eat outside, but a freaky MONSOON came along and ruined that idea! But, there are cute little bistro tables and chairs in front. Football was playing on the TV, so that would have been acceptable. I went with a Groupon deal, so they did limit choices, but only slightly! Next time we're going to have to stay longer and get some ice cream and I would like to try their salads.
We didn't have any customer service issues, but maybe because we ordered in person and ate in the store. They brought the food right to the table and you get your bottled drinksd out of the cooler yourself...so no issues for us!
We'll be back!
(5) stars. pizza is hands down the best in town. indigents are all natural. service is five stars as well. red rock pizza is highly recommended. my wife loves the fresh pasta and garlic bread!!!

We were across the street at Smith's so we decided to give it a try.  What can I say.  Small quaint lil pizza place.  Staff (I think family owned and operated) was really nice and very helpful.  I think the grandfather was making garlic knots.
Now for the food:
Wings: We got an order each of the garlic parm and mild. They were good but weren't crispy.  Maybe if you order plain they are but crispy or not I would order again.
The pizza:
We got a Medium Red Rock which was good.  Very big for a medium. Next time I would order extra cheese.
Also tried the personal size Spinach Pesto.  A lil too much spinach for me but I just pulled a lil off and it was perfect!  I typically don't like different things on my pizza but this was awesome!  Will definitely get it again.
Overall, a lil pricey but would go back again for sure!

We used to order pizza from here almost every week. It's expensive but good. Every other order used to be wrong so we stopped. We moved and I wanted to get pizza for the kids so we gave Red Rock Pizza another shot. We placed the order for 1 large Hawaiian pizza ($28) at 6:30pm and was told it would take 45 mins-60 minutes. I thought that was long for one pizza and the kids were starving but I said ok. We also live only 5 minutes from there. I called them 65 minutes later and asked the status of the delivery. The guy was nice and said it just came out of the oven and it's on the way. I live 5 minutes from there so I said ok. I waited another 25 minutes and called them back. At this point it was 90 minutes and still no pizza but "it was on the way". The not so friendly women said everything is made from scratch so it takes time (90 minutes for a large). I reminded her the time we were quoted and we were at the 90 min mark. Kids still hungry. I was super frustrated and told her that's not cool. She assured that it's on the way and I asked her to cxl the order. She then said if you want fast pizza call Pizza Hut then hung up! WTHeck!?!? Really! Customer service 101 stuff is lacking! We went from being a loyal customer weekly then being turn off...but gave it another shot. Never again! Ever! At this point, I would pay their prices for Pizza Hut quality to avoid ever going there again! I thought about putting this on my social media page but that's not cool to the owner. Hopefully he reads this and does training with his team member to avoid losing other customer!
Red Rick pizza has a many especially pizzas available! If you feel like trying something new, this will be a good place. Ei. Nacho pizza!
Just ate there for the first time and we were blown away by the amazing service and great food! The pizza, wings and Caesar salad were delicious! We will definitely be back!

This is the best THIN CRUST pizza in Vegas. Red Rock uses quality ingredients and you can taste it in the pizza. They offer a lot of unusual toppings that you won't see at other pizza places like artichoke hearts, fresh roasted garlic and goat cheese. 

My favorite pizza is the Pueblo with sweet roasted garlic, sauted mushrooms, chevre goat cheese, mozzarella, sweet red onions, and roasted peppers. Delicious! My fiance's favorite pizza is the Widow Maker, it's like a heart attack on a plate! Ham, Salami, Italian sausage, Arezzio pepperoni, Italian sausage, black olives, and Mozzarella, hold the olives please. 

The salads here are also delicious. They make thier own dressings in house and they are yummy! The garden salad is not your typical pizza place iceburg salad with a few carrots and tomotoes on top; it is lots of fresh romaine lettuce with red onions, cucumbers, black olives and tomato. The portions are generous and two people can easily share a small salad.

They offer a few dessert selections, cheesecake (haven't tried it), cannolis (pretty good) and a loaded chocolate chip cookie that is irresistable! 

Red Rock is on the pricey side for pizza, but in this case you get what you pay for. The restraunt is very casual and set up more for take out than dining in. There are some small tables and chairs, and a few outside, but it is not inviting. So we usually call our order in for takeout. The staff is very friendly and polite.

This is my favorite local delivery pizza place. The service is great, and you're always treated well by the employees here.

My favorite thing about Red Rock Pizza is the fact that they use REAL ingredients, quality food. For example, they make their crust in house and only use real cheese. I'm a stickler for quality, and that's really hard to find in a pizza delivery restaurant in Las Vegas.  They've also got some incredible gourmet pizzas. If you're into vegetarian pizza, definitely check out the Pueblo.

I'm a regular and highly recommend Red Rock Pizza!

Great vegetarian options.  I had the Pueblo (goat cheese, mushrooms, roasted garlic, red onions and red peppers) and it was amazing!  AND, they have cannoli!  Delivery took about 40 minutes, but everything was in perfect condition and temperature.

stopped by here when i went to healthy tails. started to chat with a gentleman that turned out to be the owner. Very nice and friendly fella. I liked the pizza ,i love thin crust and i also like the sausage he uses on his pizza. I also brought a pie home for my pops,he also enjoyed it as well. Also got an awesome cannoli for my yelp check in. So far i like the businesses in this mall,good people,support your local businesses !

We've ordered from Red Rock before, and the food can be good enough. Not the best pizza, but definitely not the worst. On this most recent occasion I attempted to use my soon-to-expire coupon from my Entertainment book for a delivery order but was told that I would need to present the coupon in person first and *then* have the pizza delivered or picked up. IF my coupon read "carry-out only," then I could understand this policy. However, there are no exceptions like that printed on the coupon, which means the management has chosen not to honor it as written. When I asked to speak to Paul the manager, I was told he was too "busy."  Just as I am too busy to deal with this establishment any longer.

The good: the homemade, on-the-sweeter-side sauce; the generous, fresh pizza toppings;  the moist chocolate chip cookies.
The bad: generic, bland crust; overbaked knots; indifferent management/customer service

This is our go to pizza delivery place. This is like traditional New York style. We really like the lasagna pizza if you want to try something different. The garlic knots are really good. We usually get a basic cheese or pepperoni pizza. Never disappointed!

Came in with my family to grab some lunch and when I asked the cashier if they had a restroom to wash my hands, she advised they do not have a restroom for customers. I find that to be bad customer service. Makes you wonder if they wash their hands before preparing your food. I walked right out. I can never eat at an establishment that doesn't provide a place to clean your hands or use the washroom.

I ordered a personal size chicken and jalape√±o pizza to go. When I picked it up it was hot and fresh. The guys at the shop were friendly too. 

I've had good pizza from other local pizza places and even BJ's (way too expensive), but I gotta say this pizza was everything they advertise. From my first bite, I could tell the dough, the sauce, the cheese all are fresh!  My pizza was only $9.19 and after trying it, I would've paid at least $2-3.00 more. (I hope they don't raise the prices). Even after a 15 min drive back home, the pizza was still warm enough for me to enjoy and really taste the flavor of the jalape√±os and the gooey mozzarella. Yes, the mozzarella has just the right amount of flavor you can taste. 

I would recommend checking this place out. You won't regret it and I believe the guarantee it too. This is my new favorite pizza joint in Summerlin.

Had a large catering order for this last Saturday - 65 High School kids and parents - Contacted Paul on Thursday - he gave me good suggestions on my order - I then had to call numerous times to change and up my order - every time I contacted the restaurant staff was kind and helpful.  The food was wonderful - Red Rock Pizza made our stay in Vegas awesome.

We've had their delivery, which is pretty high ($4.50), but I like HOT pizza and don't mind paying extra for quick delivery.   Pizza is either great or quite bad, but the great really is!

Thought I'd try the chicken wings the other night.  Order got screwed up and pizza was cold when delivered (we're only a half mile from them)???.  I complained, but was offered no accommodation other than "Sorry."  Not even an offer to cook me what I ordered!  

So, I pay almost $40 (minus a $5 coupon from our last order) for a cold pizza and 20 wings with sauces I didn't order.  This latest screw up, coupled with their inconsistency and lousy customer service will have us going elsewhere.  Considering there's a pizza shop on every corner, it shouldn't be too hard to find a new favorite shop, hopefully a cheaper one that appreciates their customers.

UPDATED 1/20/17:
Yeah, I may love their pizza, but the rude, uninviting attitude of one of the staff is getting to be too much for me. Like I said, I love their food, and most of the staff is awesome, but they really need to retrain or reassign this guy. His attitude is always short, rude and genuinely unpleasant to deal with. I'm not sure what his problem is, but he ALWAYS has it....and it's just about to start keeping us away. 


My new go-to pizza delivery place! Yeah, they are a little on the expensive side, but it's completely worth the extra few bucks. So far, we've loved everything we've ordered. Well, I don't really care for their garlic knots, but that's not something I would normally order anyway. Regardless, everything is obviously freshly-prepared with quality ingredients, and very quickly delivered. That's pretty much everything I'm looking for in delivery pizza.

I was actually a little bummed when my old favorite pizza place started falling the hell apart (wrong orders, long deliveries, nonexistent refunds for shitty food, etc...), but after getting reacquainted with the fine folks at Red Rock, I'm realizing that it was probably more the prices and proximity that I had formed an "allegiance" to before...not the actual food. Messed-up, right? Well, that's all over now. I'm happy to pay the higher price for the better, more consistent food at Red Rock now. 
Thanks to ********'s NY Pizzeria for chasing us away! 
I really, honestly appreciate it now.

That's about it, folks. But before I go, I would like to point-out that, unless something has changed in the last couple of days, the "place order" link on this Yelp page doesn't do anything. It looks official, and like it's doing something, but it isn't. My wife spoke to someone at Red Rock and he said that he didn't have a clue how or why that option is listed here. So yeah, don't try to order from yelp.
Clear and direct ordering, precise time provided, wrapped for take out, delicious quality pizza and a fresh salad.  I was impressed.
Just alright. Went there after hearing a raving review from a friend...but for the price I really didn't think it was anything special.
Its just pizza. Not bad. Taste good actually. However, downfall is price. Its not cheap!
Meh. We had the Groupon, couldn't use it on the lunch special so we ended up paying $19 for a mediocre large pizza. They did have a good cookie though.

Overpriced, overhyped, and when it comes down to it the pizza is just mediocre.  It might have been a little more notable if it was actually hot upon delivery.  Delivery took double the 40 minute wait quoted on the phone.  One of the 2 pizzas was room temp upon delivery.  The chicken was diced so small that could have passed for a diced veggie.  Really shocking, given the quantity of high reviews.  Maybe they were having an off day, but when the cost is over $50 for 2 gourmet pizzas, I expect the restaurant to deliver a high quality product on a consistent basis.

First I want to start off by saying their customer service is outstanding. And the deliver driver was seriously the best one I've ever come in contact with!

The food was great!! I suggest not ordering fries for delivery, they were good (and I'd imagine they'd be excellent if ordered dinning in) but you know how fries get soggy after a while. The pizza was great, finally someone that understands the term of LIGHT sauce and or topping. They also threw in a tester of their garlic knots which I  now upset I didn't order cause they are amazing! I will def. be back!

I had dinner here this week, and while waiting for my dine-in order, I checked on here to see what people had to say.

My response?  "Oh, crap."

Fortunately for me, I didn't have the customer service nightmare that other reviewers had.  So that leads me to believe that the issue must be either with: take-out, delivery, or someone that works here got the memo and decided to work on their customer service techniques.

If anything, the service was very friendly.  Quick, talkative, checked in often to see how we were doing... they even stopped us when we went to select our drinks as the colder drinks were in the back of their fridge.  Why? They wanted to point those out over the still warm ones they had recently placed in there.  Again, little gestures.

We got two personal pizzas: Cordon Bleu and Cajun Queen.  And those were some really tasty 'zas, especially sharing between ourselves.  Someone else on here pointed out this place's wings, and I am a HUGE wing enthusiast.  These are definitely some mighty fine wings.  I ate those like they were going out of style.

I don't know what to say: The meal was really good, the service contradicted the other reviews on here (which was a relief for us), and yes, the prices are a little high, but the quality and variety was there.

To start with the pizza is mediocre at best. I stopped in and got 2 slices and a soda. The people were pleasant enough when dealing with me. The pizza is about the same grade as chain stores like domino's or papa Johns. Crust tasted and had the texture of those premade things you get in Vons bland sauce and very little seasoning overall. You are also blocked from seeing the pizza being made which I find unusual

The pizza was not the big problem because even bad pizza is kind of okay. The problem is that the staff arguing loudly with each other in the open kitchen. I was the only one in there and one guy was going on and on about how he's not going to let the other employees walk all over him anymore.  This went on for about 10 minutes and then they went on to other subjects. 
Someone must have been working on the building because the power went out. At this point the staff decided since the power was out that I must be unable to hear them cursing and belching (yes belching) really loudly. At this point I finished and left. No more money for pizza that wasn't any better than frozen or for the completely unprofessional staff. How this place is getting 4 and 5 stars is beyond me. 
I'll stick with Roccos it's only 5 minutes away
The best bbq chicken pizza ever!  We moved about 30 miles away and still come here for the best pizza....only wish they delivered in our area.  Definitely worth the drive though

I'd rate them zero if I could. My husband and I came here at 7:30 on a Friday night and the place was completely empty, we went inside where we stood at the counter, completely ignored by four employees who made eye contact with us, yet continued their personal conversations. They never acknowledged us. We were the ONLY people in there. After several minutes, we decided to leave since it was obvious they were not going to serve us. As we were leaving, I said, "We were hoping to order; I guess you didn't want our business." One of the employees shouted sarcastically, "I'm sooooo sorry," and then proceeded to follow us out to our car being belligerent. No wonder this place is empty on a Friday night!!!

Great food, nasty employees.
There were a couple girls, and a guy working in the kitchen when we came by.  One girl greeted us, and the other girl came up to the counter....looked at us...picked her nose...and walked off.  I'm not sure if this is some inside joke that the people working there have, or just a really bad habit (another reviewer has mentioned a nose-picking employee), but I am NOT a fan.
I kind of wanted to leave at that point, but we already bought the groupon, so we placed an order anyway.  The food was actually really good.  The pizza had a thin crust, and tons of fresh toppings.  I really loved their hot wings. They're baked, and they don't have that nasty super thick fat skin on them.  It would be nice if the prices were a little lower (especially since this place has absolutely no ambiance), but meh.
I will probably come back here, because I really liked the food, but  I would feel a lot better about it if the employees kept their snot off my pizza.

Nice Pizzeria located in Summerlin. Staff was very nice very inviting very helpful ordered the Widowmaker was loaded nice tasty it was a pleasant surprise at the pepperoni meatballs with cheese garlic knots were also great. I would say that this is one of the top five places in the are.
Fresh and high quality ingredients.  Widow maker pizza is the bomb. Awesome homemade desserts. A little pricey but worth it

In a town filled with franchise restaurants it's nice to have a home grown real pizza place to count on! Every time I go here the food is hot, fresh, and delicious! Ordered personal pizza and was just enough ..actually more than enough bc I couldn't finish it ! Wings were delicious,  garlic knots with homemade marinara sauce. .yummm. a great dinner before goin out drinking in vegas! Thanks Paulie!

Best Pizza in Vegas! Heck....one of the best on the left coast! Great family feel, wonderful food and great prices!! Why would you go anywhere else for Pizza when you're in Vegas? Oh....and if you are just visiting, they deliver! I recommend the garlic knots!

We ordered a pizza for delivery. Granted it was Valentine's Day our delivery took an hour and we are less than 3 miles away. We chose a large half Philly cheesesteak, and half pepperoni, mushroom and ricotta. The philly was dry with no sauce. While the other half was pretty much mediocre. Including tip $30 for a large pizza. Save your money and order dominos...

I love this place. It's a few buildings down from where I work and we order from there all the time. Can't go wrong with anything on their menu, everything is delicious and everyone who works in there are as sweet as can be and super nice! Definitely recommend!
We ordered the taco nacho pizza and it was wonderful! The medium size was fairly large and between the two of us we couldn't finish it. Highly recommend!
Solid pizza, good wings. This is the best delivery pizza in the area, bar none. Don't waste your time with Dominos or Pizza Hut...do yourself a favor and get a real pizza at a reasonable price!

Red Rock Pizza is officially the only place I will order pizza. The price is a bit more than what you'd find at Pizza Hut or Dominos, but the portions are large (a small pizza and small side salad make a fine lunch for two for about $16) and the taste it quite worth it (unique, specialty offerings with fresh ingredients)!
 
So far, here's my take on a few of the items I've tried:
*The Pueblo (mushrooms, GOAT CHEESE, onions, and red peppers; sundried tomatoes for $1 more): Possibly my favorite. I love goat cheese, but not a lot of pizza parlors offer it. Love the unique ingredients. Also, you MUST get it with the sundried tomatoes! It makes the pizza.
*Tesoro (Artichoke hearts, tomatoes, olives, red peppers, broccoli, and feta cheese): Apparently this is their best-selling vegetarian pizza, and I can see why. The veggies are so fresh and seasoned to perfection. They also don't skimp on the toppings, and my pizza was literally overflowing with tasty artichoke hearts.
*Eggplant Rollatini (eggplant, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese): So good. It's basically like an Eggplant Parmesan pizza. I don't even need to go any further--- it's just so, so good,
*Cheesy Onion Roll: Greasy, but delicious. You might feel guilty eating it...
*Garlic Knots: Not bad, but a bit dry. Opt for the Cheesy Onion Roll if you're looking for a scrumptious, carb-mazing side!
*Garden Salad: We got this one with the house-made Blue Cheese dressing. Not a huge fan of the dressing, as it was very runny. I like a thick blue cheese dressing with blue cheese chunks, but this one resembled a watered-down ranch. Meh. Salad was simple.
*Red Rock Salad: Barely needs dressing, as the artichokes and red peppers bring a lot of seasoning and oils to the salad. Excellent!

Sure, it costs more than your run-of-the-mill pizza place, like Pizza Hut or Dominos, but what you get is good quality food and service. The only thing that would make this place better is if they had an option to order pizza online!
First time here, great experience! The wings were decent but the pizza was really good. The atmosphere is welcoming, I'll definitely be back.

I have eaten there twice and both times I am not impressed with the pizza or calzone. My suggestion would be to make a more artisan style pizza with a thinner crust and progressive toppings. They are located an area where there is a lot of foodies looking for a top notch pizza place locally. The staff is very friendly but the pizza is too ordinary.
Do not come here!!!! Very very rude people when I called to order!! They cussed at my sister over the phone and then hung up on her!!! Not wasting my time here and will not dare give them business!!
This place is a gem. We randomly found this little pizza joint. They have some unique designer pizzas I'll  definately have to try.
I don't know if it's because I'm preggers and craving pizza today or that this pizza is phenomenal...but regardless, it sure hit the spot!! So yummy-licious!!!  I'll be back for sure!!

This is our neighbourhood go-to pizza place.  Great flavours, friendly staff, a couple delicious garlic knots that come with every pizza and consistent quality.  Of all the flavours, Widowmaker and Red Rock are our favourites.  Their cannoli's are great too!  I've only ordered takeout so I can't say anything about their delivery service.  They've been attaching a $5 coupon off $20 which we consistently use.

I can comfortable give this place a solid 4 stars I tried the philly pizza,chicken wings.  - Normally I judge pizza places bye this or there white pizza's due to the fact you can mess this up really bad or do it justice. 

First off delivery was super fast I am still waiting on my maintenance call since 9 am ! at my apartments however called them up and got here in under 30 mins not bad !. 

The Philly -- the toppings are amazing ! the philly meat not shure what cut there using  for it has great flavor and not hard or tough to eat but verry good. ! My one negative on the Sicilian style pizza ( thin crust for non consumers . ) is a little tough to eat maybe recommend a dipping sauce like marinara to dip it in. either for to go or delivery might be a good idea. 

Chicken Wings these are baked off witch the trick is not getting or serving raw ones trust me from owning a pizza joint this tends to happen. However these where done perfectly and also they make there own blue cheese - ranch dressing you can tell the difference compared to some of the places I have been too. 

Living in Summerlin its a bit tricky on pizza I am happy to find a new one that delivers close to home its a toss up ( drum roll ) lol between Red Rock Pizza and Those Guys. 

Ohh and pizza was not salty nor buttery sometimes people wonder about this weather its the sauce etc.. Perfect seasoning through out the meal. 

Defiantly worth checking out if your in Summerlin -- They do have dinning room however tad bit small and I am shure like every where else in the valley during weekends it gets crazy. 

Side note -- Prices are perfect also with pizza they serve you Garlic Knots for free!

The customer service is decent, they have no bathroom in the restaurant so make sure you go before or wait till you leave! 

Let me start with the pizza. I got a pepperoni pizza, the 2 slices for $5 (something like that) but it was GREAT the pizza tastes so good, it has that crust that I love crunchy but not too crunchy or dry. 

I also tried their garlic knots bc i saw "best garlic knots ever" on one of the reviews, but personally they were really gross to me. Other than that can't really complain, will be going back for some more pizza though!!
